bibliographic-data.invention-title: METHOD AND APPARATUS FOR DERIVING BENCHMARKS FOR TRADING INSTRUMENTS

nplcit.text: Bond Price Data and Bond Market Liquidity. Sarig and Warga. Journal of Financial and Quantitative Analysis. pp. 367-378. September 1989. Vol. 24, No. 3
Opening and Closing the Market: Evidence from the London Stock Exchange. Ellul, Shin, and Tonks. The Journal of Financial and Quantitative Analysis. pp. 779-801. December 2005. vol 40, no. 4
Quantifying market order execution quality at the New York stock exchange. Bacidore, Ross, and Sofianos. Journal of Financial Markets. vol 6, issue 3. pp. 281-307. May 2003

abstract.p: Benchmarks for the price of a financial instrument such as FX spot rate for a currency pair are calculated by an algorithm based on a previous benchmark and a market price. The market price is derived from a deal price and a quote price. The deal price is based on deals conducted since the last benchmark and the quote price is based on bids and offers entered since the last benchmark. For each of the deal and quote prices, a price, weight and scatter is calculated which is used to calculate a benchmark price, weight and scatter and a benchmark error.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: METHOD AND APPARATUS FOR DERIVING BENCHMARKS FOR TRADING INSTRUMENTS

VERFAHREN UND VORRICHTUNG ZUM ABLEITEN VON BENCHMARKS FÜR INSTRUMENTENHANDEL
PROCEDE ET APPAREIL DE DERIVATION DE POINTS DE REFERENCE D'INSTRUMENTS COMMERCIAUX
Method and apparatus for deriving benchmarks for trading instruments

abstract.p: Benchmarks for the price of a financial instrument such as FX spot rate for a currency pair are calculated by an algorithm based on a previous benchmark and a market price. The market price is derived from a deal price and a quote price. The deal price is based on deals conducted since the last benchmark and the quote price is based on bids and offers entered since the last benchmark. For each of the deal and quote prices, a price, weight and scatter is calculated which is used to calculate a benchmark price, weight and scatter and a benchmark error.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: METHOD AND APPARATUS FOR DERIVING BENCHMARKS FOR TRADING INSTRUMENTS
PROCEDE ET APPAREIL DE DERIVATION DE POINTS DE REFERENCE D'INSTRUMENTS COMMERCIAUX

abstract.p: Benchmarks for the price of a financial instrument such as FX spot rate for a currency pair are calculated by an algorithm based on a previous benchmark and a market price. The market price is derived from a deal price and a quote price. The deal price is based on deals conducted since the last benchmark and the quote price is based on bids and offers entered since the last benchmark. For each of the deal and quote prices, a price, weight and scatter is calculated which is used to calculate a benchmark price, weight and scatter and a benchmark error.

L'invention concerne des points de référence de valeur d'un instrument financier, tel que le cours du change au comptant pour une paire de devises, calculés à l'aide d'un algorithme basé sur un point de référence antérieur et une valeur de marché. La valeur de marché est dérivée d'un cours de négociation et d'un cours coté. Le cours de négociation est basé sur les négociations réalisées depuis le point de référence antérieur et le cours coté est basé sur les offres d'achat réalisées depuis le point de référence antérieur. Une valeur, un coefficient de pondération et un coefficient de dispersion sont calculés pour le cours de négociation et le cours coté, permettant de calculer la valeur, le coefficient de pondération et le coefficent de dispersion d'un point de référence, et une erreur de point de référence.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: METHOD AND APPARATUS FOR DERIVING BENCHMARKS FOR TRADING INSTRUMENTS
PROCEDE ET APPAREIL DE DERIVATION DE POINTS DE REFERENCE D'INSTRUMENTS COMMERCIAUX

For each of the deal and quote prices, a price, weight and scatter is calculated which is used to calculate a benchmark price, weight and scatter and a benchmark error.
